reviews.review: got chased for all gens then T-bagged soooo good game
Too many player update error and save error.My blood points had been stolen and never give back.

Much like an abusive loved one, this game is cruel, unfair, broken, and toxic. However, I can't stop playing it; I keep coming back to it, and I keep spending money on it. Not only do you have to spend money to unlock the best killers, survivors, and the best perks making this game I paid $20 (base) for pay-to-win, you then have to take hours of your time to level up those characters to be able to take those perks from the characters you bought and put them on other characters. Every time I find myself unable to keep up with the competition, I find out that I need a perk that is locked behind a $5 (or even $12) paywall. I try my best and always come up  short as I never have the free time to grind all these different characters.

The matchmaking system in this game is Godawful. I'm in my first month of playing as of writing this and I get put against toxic Red Ranks with maxed out perks for premium characters who ridicule me for not having the best perks or the game knowledge that they do even going as far as to call me slurs. I report these players (as I'm sure lots of people do) and much like a Hydra, for every one player that gets "banned" 3 more show up. Most games offer a casual mode or a Newcomer's mode to circumvent this but not this game. This game throws each and every player fresh out of its tutorial into a ranked competitive ladder.

The further and further down I go with this review, the more I question if this game TRULY has any redeeming qualities. The lore and world building is great but none of that affects gameplay at all. All characters are mute aside from screaming and moans of pain. Games like Valorant and Overwatch have certain interactions between characters to make the world around the player feel more alive. These locations in The Entity's realm have bearing on the survivors and killers so why not let them express it? This game has so much potential but is simply bottlenecked by the developer's lack of awareness to what the community has been asking for for years instead pushing to add a K-Pop star killer (that I can't imagine anybody asked for).

In conclusion, as I finish my midnight rambling in my sleep-deprived rage I offer my genuine thoughts of the game that I've tried so desperately to enjoy; Give it a couple more years before purchasing. Despite this game coming out 5 years ago, this game still feels like its in early beta on every platform. It is inevitable for the developers to check what the community says at some point and when they finally step out of their ivory palace of obliviousness, this game can finally strive and be enjoyed but until then, do not play this game.

Devs are doing NFT garbage now for Pinhead.

They're too cowardly to implement his dialogue and now they're up to this nonsense.

Nope, I'm good. Your game sucked enough as it is.

So far, so good. I love this game and its great to play with friends. Very scary and keeps me on my toes. Lots of content and great character choices too! Most definitely recommend others to play it as well.
Fun game for kids who were bullied in school.
If you want something to do for countless hours, this is the game to sink your time into.

everything about this game is great

Maybe its just me being unlucky, but my experience of this game was not good. First, it lagged on my good computer. Second, I played survivor about 5 times in a row and each time lost because everybody was camping or trying to free others and dying themselves. I tried killer after that and waited 7 minutes and no game. I left after that and promptly undownloaded it. I didn't know how to refund until a month later, so 10 dollars wasted I guess.

I love this game!
It's easy to learn, hard to master. Fun for casual playing with friends for sure, while providing players with enough depth to improve and play on a more competitive level if they want.
Only downside is a rather toxic playerbase.
Bom jogo pra passar raiva com randoms.
I love this game it has caused me so much pain

Been playing this game daily for a few weeks now and I can assure you that it's absolutely worth buying.

From a survivor's perspective, this game can be quite tricky. Not only do you have to finish generators but also look out for eachother in hopes to escape together. Sadly you will encounter killers that not only camp you once you got hooked but also target you until you're either dead or escaped. It makes it not very enjoyable but it's not a common occasion.

I've personally liked this game more when playing with friends while goofing around on Discord instead of going in solo as the commucation can help quite a lot. 

Buy it, try it and I can promise that you'll get addicted once you figured out how to play it.
